name: ExternalStorage.Cache
comment:
# Defining a cache
@docs Cache, create, Update

aliases.name: Update
aliases.comment:
A cache update command.
Indicates that a new value has to be inserted to the cache or an existing value has to be removed from it.

    port feed : Signal Cache.Update
aliases.type: Maybe { url : String, value : Maybe Value }

aliases.name: Cache
aliases.comment:
Stores JSON values (potentially coming from an external storage) associated with their URLs.

    cache : Signal Cache

values.name: create
values.comment:
Maintains the state of a cache by processing an update feed.

    cache = feed |> Cache.create

name: ExternalStorage.Reference
comment:
# Referring values in a cache
@docs Reference, Error, create, decoder

aliases.name: Reference
aliases.type: { url : String, get : Cache -> Result Error a }

types.name: Error
types.comment:
The various error cases that might happen when dereferencing an object.

    viewError url error =
      case error of
        NotFound -> "Loading " ++ url
        DecodingFailed message -> "Can't decode " ++ url ++ ": " ++ message

values.name: create
values.comment:
Creates a reference to the object at the given URL.
The object will be looked up from an arbitrary cache and decoded with the given decoder.

    book : Reference Book
    book = "http://example.com/book" |> create bookDecoder

values.name: decoder
values.comment:
Decodes a JavaScript string to a remote reference.

    bookDecoder =
      object2 Book
        ("title" := string)
        ("authors" := list (decoder writerDecoder))
